JobTitle: US E-EA - Marketing Manager - Tax (Legal Business Services)
JobFullDesc: Marketing Manager - Tax (Legal Business Services) Are you a marketing and communications professional - with strong ties to professional services marketing - who is unafraid to think differently, always thinks strategically, and keeps current on the latest trends? If this is you, hit the "apply now" button!Work you'll doThe Strategic Marketing Planner (SMP) serves as a trusted marketing advisor to his/her business leaders and key stakeholders. It also executes with agility and measurable performance through best-of-breed solutions, centralization of key information and operations, and optimization of data, tools, people and process.Qualifications includeRequired: 10+ years of related experience in marketing, with a focus on marketing and communications strategy and planningUnderstanding of integrated marketing communications strategies and tactics and how they come together to provide measurable resultsTeam oriented approach with ability to take initiative, prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously to meet client expectations and deadlines across multiple projectsFlexibility and adaptability and level of comfort with ambiguity and fluid prioritiesStrong project management skillsSuperior Microsoft Office skills (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook); familiarity with integrating various technologies to support marketing effortsBachelor's Degree in Marketing, Communications, English, or related business field; Advanced degrees preferredTravel up to 15% (while travel of up to 15% is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future
